result.execSummary:
The defendant JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Chippewa County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE - 30 days to pay or request a payment plan. 
Due 5/13/2022.
All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Plus supervision fees. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Absolute sobriety. 
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs. 
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed. 
Not to possess syringes unless medically required. 
Not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Not to associate with anyone involved in illegal drug activities.

Apply to Chippewa County Treatment Court, and if accepted, make a good faith effort to successfully complete. 
Any other assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER

records.addlTxt:
8:44 AM Defendant JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER in court. New sober date. Court orders defendant to immediately report to the jail. To be held pending placement into residential treatment. Deputy Krutz takes defendant into custody. 

Cases 21CF466 & 22CF142

8:54 AM Defendant JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER in court. New sober date. Court orders defendant to report to jail tomorrow morning after work at 6:00am (10/14/2022). To be released at 8:00am on Monday, 10/17/2022. If ETG comes back positive, defendant to remain in custody until placed into residential treatment. If ETG is not back, defendant to be released on 10/17/2022.
8:48 AM Defendant JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER in court. Sanction: 4 hrs community service

Sheila Yonk appeared for State of WIsconsin. Joseph Russell Belcher did not appear.
21CF466, 22CF142
Court calls case and notes appearances
Court notes defendant appeared in recovery court 09-01-2022 with an order to appear @ 3am to jail on 09-01-2022
Court amends time to appear to jail to 6 am on 09-02-2022
8:55 AM Defendant JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER in court. New sober date. Lied about sobriety. Defendant to report to jail at 3:00am on 9/2/2022 and released at 8:00am on Monday, 9/5/2022.
8:57 AM Defendant JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER in court. New sober date. Court orders reading assignment packet.
9:17 AM Defendant JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER in court. New sober date 8/6/22 Court orders defendant to speak to CJS to get referral for CAR.
8:36 AM Defendant JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER in court. Defendant has new sober date. Defendant on sober track for 60 days. Court allows defendant to advance into next phase.
Return of CHSO's DNA sample/testing form letter

3:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER in court, in custody.  Attorney David W. Field in court for JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Acknowledges prior conviction(s). 
21CT21, Count 1, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
21CF466, Amended Count 1, OWI 3, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
21CF466, Count 5, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
22CF142, Count 1, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

Remaining charges DRI. 21CF467, Uncharged DA case 21CH1111, 21TR881, 22CF116, & 22CF194 DRI.

Court orders: 

21CT21, Count 1
$1550 fine
$36.40 BAC
20 days jail, Huber, 15 days credit
16 mo dl rev, retroactive
12 mo IID, half price
AODA/DSP 

21CF466, Count 1
$2450 fine
$36.40 BAC
80 days jail, 1 day credit, Huber, consecutive to 21ct21
27 months dl rev, retroactive
1 year IID, half price
AODA/DSP

21CF466, Count 5 & 22CF142, Count 1
Sentence withheld, 36 months probation
21CF466, Count 5, 180 days conditional jail, stayed, consecutive to any other sentence currently serving
